channel.description: Logical Constructs Use test conditions, which decides what to do next based on the true or false status of the condition. The shell offers two logical constructs: if-then-fi case Exit Codes (exit values) Refer to the value returned by a command when it finishes execution. Value is based on the outcome of the command. If the command runs successfully, you typically get a zero exit code(return code), otherwise you get a non-zero value. Return code is stored in a special shell parameter called ? (question mark). Letâ€™s look at the following two examples to understand their usage:
